{"id":543234015,"lang":"cpp","time":"2 months, 4 weeks","timestamp":1629777144,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"28 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/543234015/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Add Two Numbers","memory":"71.5 MB","code":"/**\n * Definition for singly-linked list.\n * struct ListNode {\n *     int val;\n *     ListNode *next;\n *     ListNode() : val(0), next(nullptr) {}\n *     ListNode(int x) : val(x), next(nullptr) {}\n *     ListNode(int x, ListNode *next) : val(x), next(next) {}\n * };\n */\nclass Solution {\npublic:\n    ListNode* addTwoNumbers(ListNode* l1, ListNode* l2) {\n        ListNode* dummyNode = new ListNode(0);\n        ListNode* p = l1;\n        ListNode* q = l2;\n        ListNode* curr = dummyNode;\n        int carry = 0;\n        while(p!=NULL || q!=NULL){\n            int x = (p!=NULL) ? p->val:0;\n            int y = (q!=NULL) ? q->val:0;\n            int sum = carry+x+y;\n            carry = sum/10;\n            curr->next = new ListNode(sum%10);\n            curr = curr->next;\n            if(p!=NULL)\n                p = p->next;\n            if(q!=NULL)\n                q= q->next;\n        }\n        if(carry > 0)\n            curr->next = new ListNode(carry);\n         return dummyNode->next;\n    }\n   \n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"add-two-numbers"}
